heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0106/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Adds: “notes that the potential suspension of the visa liberalisation agreement would primarily harm the people of Georgia;” The para calls for a review, not outright suspension. Moreover, the EU visa liberalisation was granted on the mandatory condition of respect for democratic principles, the rule of law, and human rights, and Georgia does not appear to comply anymore with these conditions.
vl_title_en: Further deterioration of the political situation in Georgia

file_name: VOLF EMPL 20242084INI European Semester Abadia Jover_EN.docx
vt_title_en: Abadía Jover (A10-0023/2025) - European Semester for economic policy coordination: employment and social priorities for 2025
Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. AM from the extreme left. Calls for peace and for “putting an end to the strategy of instigating and prolonging the war”.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. AM from the extreme left. Some parts are against Group position

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. AM from the extreme left. Implies that the EU pursues a policy of confrontation, arms escalation and war

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. AM from the extreme left. Critical of “the promotion of militarism, arms escalation and war”;

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. AM from the extreme left. Similarly, implies that the EU promotes militarism, arms escalation and war;

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: original text
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. Marks three years since Russia's full-scale aggression, honours those who fought for Ukraine, and reaffirms solidarity, sovereignty, and self-defence rights.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: original text
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. Condemns Russia’s war, demands full withdrawal, an end to attacks and deportations, and reaffirms non-recognition of occupied territories.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. Condemns Russia’s aggression. Vote on text as a whole excluding the words “and in that response ... by the EU”, in full below

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. These words: “and that the response to this necessitates bold, brave and comprehensive political, security and financial decisions by the EU”

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. AM from the extreme right.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: original text
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. Warns that the war’s outcome will shape future actions of other authoritarian regimes.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. From extreme left. Expresses concern that that EU leaders continue to pursue warmongering solutions.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. From extreme left. Unrealistic and superficial.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. 1st half of para, expresses concern over the U.S. shift, suspending military aid, and pressuring Ukraine to relinquish self-defence and territorial rights.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. “stresses that, in ... reconstruction and recovery;” excluding the words “in light of this change”; “now”; ”as the largest donor to Ukraine” and  “ to replace suspended USAID funding,”, thus without wording referring to the US.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. Vote on these words critical of the new US stance:“in light of this change”; “now”; ”as the largest donor to Ukraine” and  “ to replace suspended USAID funding,”

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. “Reiterates its call ... and engineering equipment);” excluding the words “in the light ... to satellite imagery.”

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. “In light of the regrettable decision of the US administration to cease all military assistance, intelligence sharing and access to satellite imagery”

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks:
Maintain the negotiated text.
Urges Member States to partner with Ukraine’s defence industry to optimise critical equipment production, following Danish and Dutch examples.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
remarks: Maintain the negotiated text. Reiterates that EU and NATO allies should support Ukraine with at least 0.25% of their GDP annually.

vt_title_en: Continuing the unwavering EU support for Ukraine, after three years of Russia’s war of aggression
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0156/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)

heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Recalls that Syria has faced a violent operation of interference, subversion and aggression by the US and other NATO member countries

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: Condemns the recent killings of civilians in north-western Syria;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: emphasises that the mass arrival of migrants from Syria systematically destabilised the receiving countries

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: Emphasises the need to encourage and facilitate the return of Syrians residing in the EU to their home country, underlining that Syria’s reconstruction requires human capital;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Deplores the illegalisation and persecution of Syrian democratic and secular forces, had their assets confiscated and were unable to reorganise as political or social forces;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Denounces the climate of violence, including murders, kidnappings, robberies, looting and extortion, which prevails under the new Syrian leadership

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: Denounces the naivety of the West and the EEAS towards the jihadist factions which are now in the government; calls on the HRVP to cease any complacency regarding human rights violations in Syria

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Strongly denounces and condemns the massacres perpetrated by the armed groups of the new Syrian leadership

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ECR

heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ESN
remarks: US Secretary of State condemning the radical Islamist terrorists that murdered people in western Syria; is seriously concerned about the safety of Syria’s minorities

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: to engage with churches to foster reconciliation and inclusive and civic dialogue,; support churches in Syria providing humanitarian assistance

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: Recalls that any EU support must not benefit the remnants of the Assad regime or any terrorist groups within Syria or abroad

author: original text

heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: Calls for the EU and its Member States to provide capacity-building in this regard [for pluralistic media landscape]

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: “funding and” [for pluralistic media landscape]

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: Calls on the interim authorities to fully cooperate with competent international bodies, including UN mechanisms established specifically for investigating serious crimes in Syria, recognises the irreplaceable contribution of Fareed al-Madhhan (‘Caesar’); calls for the EU to support the renewal of the mandate of the Independent International Commission of Inquiry on Syria

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: “and increase funding for all relevant mechanisms, in particular in the light of US disinvestment”

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ESN
remarks: new common approach on returns should support the return of Syrians who are irregularly present in the Member States;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: Welcomes the announcement by the Commission to allocate EUR 235 million in new humanitarian support to Syrians and calls for the EU and its Member States to sustain humanitarian and development aid efforts and to maintain financial support for neighbouring countries hosting Syrian refugees; invites the EU to explore pathways to use frozen assets of the Assad regime for a trust fund for Syrian reconstruction, rehabilitation and compensation of victims;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: is extremely concerned by the suspension of all USAID funding related to Syria or Syrian refugees and by the foreseen non-participation of the US in the next Brussels conference

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: Greens/ EFA
remarks: Calls on MS for reversing the suspension of pending asylum applications

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ESN
remarks: Encourages war refugees to return to their country now

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ESN
remarks: Deletes “and the role of the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) in assisting its needs”

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text
remarks: Recalls the presence of over 400 000 Palestinian refugees residing in Syria, some of them displaced multiple times, and the role of the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) in assisting its needs;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: recalls that the European Union does not recognise Israel’s sovereignty over the occupied Golan Heights

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ECREPP
remarks: Mentions neighbouring countries instead of Türkiye and Israel to respect Syria’s territorial integrity and sovereignty and to immediately cease all attacks and incursions on and occupation of Syrian territory;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text
remarks: Calls on Türkiye and Israel to respect Syria’s territorial integrity and sovereignty and to immediately cease all attacks and incursions on and occupation of Syrian territory in full compliance with international law;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Demands the immediate suspension of the EU-Israel Association Agreement

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: Asks for a Syrian-led political solution, between the caretaker authorities and the Kurdish-led Democratic Autonomous Administration of North and East Syria/SDF;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: EU and Member States must support the implementation of the agreement between the Syrian transitional government and the Kurdish-led SDF

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks:
fight remaining terrorist active cells,  investigate past crimes against all communities, 
adoption 32 = 19 falls

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ESN
remarks: investigate past crimes, notably against the Yazidi community and the Christian communities;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: Urgently calls for a lasting solution to be found among all the parties concerned as these camps continue to be breeding grounds for radicalisation and constitute a dormant threat to both Syrian and European security; warns against the serious international security risk a sudden disengagement of the United States in the region would cause in this uncertain context;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: reiterates its call on the Member States to repatriate all their nationals, especially children, from the Al-Hol and Roj detention camps and to bring adults to justice in fair trials;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: Condemns those European politicians, including current and former MEPs, who have repeatedly spread pro-Assad narratives and actively engaged in whitewashing the bloody dictatorship; expresses deep concern regarding the recent invitation by Parliament’s Intergroup on Christians in the Middle East of organisations closely linked to EU-sanctioned Assadists;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: Condemns those European politicians, including current and former MEPs, who have repeatedly spread pro-Assad narratives and actively engaged in whitewashing the bloody dictatorship;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: expresses deep concern regarding the recent invitation by Parliament’s Intergroup on Christians in the Middle East of organisations closely linked to EU-sanctioned Assadists;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ESN
remarks: expresses concern about the preservation and restoration of Christian buildings in Syria damaged by the civil war;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: Instructs its President to forward this resolution to the relevant EU institutions, the governments and parliaments of the Member States and the interim Syrian government,

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: and to have it translated and published in Arabic

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: The Left
remarks: HTS as offshoot of the former branch of al-Qaeda in Syria

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: new non-sectarian, comprehensive, credible and inclusive government that includes all components of Syria’s diverse ethnic and religious communities;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ECR
remarks: Ahmed al-Sharaa previously a member of the Islamic State of Iraq, pledged allegiance to Al-Qaeda; never expressed regret for that

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ECREPP
remarks: deplores also the confirmed killings of at least 10 Christians;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ECR
remarks: atrocities committed by forces linked to HTS against civilians district of Latakia, crimes in the Alawite Alawite pilgrimage;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: whereas Israel has occupied a part of the Syrian territory in the Golan Heights since 1967; whereas following the overthrow of the Assad regime, Israel has further seized the UN-patrolled demilitarised zone beyond the Golan Heights and repeatedly carried out strikes on military targets in Syria;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
remarks: whereas the Israeli Minister of Defence has declared that ‘the IDF [Israel Defense Forces] will remain at the summit of Mount Hermon and the security zone indefinitely’;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: original text
remarks: whereas the Assad regime supported Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and recognised the occupied Luhansk and Donetsk regions in Ukraine, as well as the Abkhazia region in Georgia; whereas Ukraine’s military intelligence service systematically reported that Russia was training mercenaries recruited in Syria to support Russia’s war against Ukraine; whereas the ‘Grain from Ukraine’ initiative was deployed in Syria after the suspension of Russian food exports;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: Daesh has caused tremendous suffering in Syria, in particular targeting Christian and Yazidi communities

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: ECR
remarks: Assad regime attempted to project an image as a secular protector of Christians and other religious and ethnic communities in Syria, but the regime reportedly intentionally destroyed churches and detained at least several hundred Christian citizens; the regime, with active support of Russian forces, besieged and completely decimated Aleppo, the city with the largest Christian population in the country;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: more than half of the children in Syria are out of school;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: over the past 13 years, the EU and its Member States have mobilised more than EUR 33.3 billion in assistance for the Syrian crisis;

vt_title_en: The need for EU support towards a just transition and reconstruction in Syria
heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0157/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/EFA)
author: PfE
remarks: 1 million Syrian refugees have received asylum in European countries; whereas many more reside illegally in Europe;

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
remarks: Reaffirms, in this regard, that research and innovation remain crucial for the EU’s success in cutting-edge industries and new clean and sustainable technologies; recalls the long-standing goal of pushing research & innovation investment to 3% of GDP; calls, therefore, for increased funding to be provided under Horizon Europe to fund at least 50% of all excellent proposals in all scientific disciplines, enable researchers as well as companies, especially SMEs, to bring new developments to the market, and to scale up, to ensure solid economic growth and to boost the Union’s competitiveness in the global economy, thereby preventing actors to leave for competing regions
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
remarks: while also ensuring Europe has the knowledge base it needs to pursue the Green Deal commitments;

author: Original text
remarks:
Against the compromise
ORAL Amendment
“Calls for the extension of funding opportunities from European funds, including through the Integrated Border Management Fund, to support the engineering preparation of border areas in countries threatened by hybrid activities and conventional armed aggression by third countries, particularly in Member States located in the eastern part of the European Union”
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
author: original text
remarks: recalls the vital role that the Integrated Border Management Fund, the Border Management and Visa Instrument (BMVI) and the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund play in protecting external borders; calls, in addition, for appropriate funding for border protection capabilities, including physical infrastructure, buildings, equipment, systems and services required at border crossing points, as provided for in Annex III to the BMVI Regulation , and for the requirements to be met in terms of reception conditions, integration, return and readmission procedure; reaffirms that cooperation agreements with non-EU countries in full respect of international law can help to prevent irregular migration and strengthen border security;
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
author: original text
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
remarks: Insists that continued investment in EU4Health and Cluster Health in Horizon Europe are key to improving health and preparedness for future health crises, thereby improving the health status of EU citizens; stresses the need for health investments for maximum impact; highlights its support for a holistic regulatory and funding approach to Europe’s life sciences and biotech ecosystem, including the creation of cutting-edge European clusters of excellence, as a central pillar of a stronger European health union, to which a European plan for cardiovascular diseases and lifestyles should be added, focusing on primary and secondary prevention as key objectives to increase life expectancy in the EU; highlights the need to create a more supportive care system to respond to demographic challenges and the ageing population; reiterates its support for Europe’s Beating Cancer Plan, as well as the importance of European investment in tackling childhood diseases, rare diseases and antimicrobial resistance; reiterates the importance of the gender aspect of health, is highly concerned by the current mental health crisis in Europe, affecting in particular the young generation, exacerbated by recent global events, which requires immediate action to be taken; underlines the need to prevent shortages of critical medicines, medical countermeasures and healthcare workers faced by some Member States; calls, in this respect, for better coordination at EU level and joint procurement of medicines in order to reduce costs;
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
remarks: “including sexual and reproductive health”
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
remarks: “Insists on the benefits of pre-accession funds, both for the enlargement countries and for the EU itself, as the funding creates more stability in the region; insists on the need to deploy the necessary funds to support Moldova’s accession process, in line with the EU’s commitment to enlargement and regional stability; underlines the role of the Reform and Growth Facility for the Republic of Moldova and highlights the necessity of securing sufficient financial resources for its full implementation; underlines the importance of sustained support for candidate countries in implementing the necessary accession-related reforms, in particular regarding the rule of law, anti-corruption and democracy and in enhancing their resilience and preventing and countering hybrid threats;”
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3
remarks: “welcomes the implementation of the Growth Plan for the Western Balkans to further support the economic convergence of Western Balkan countries with the EU’s single market through investment and growth in the region”
vl_title_en: Guidelines for the 2026 budget - Section III

file_name: VOLF 20242110(BUI) Guidelines Budget 2026 Andrzej HALICKI _ final V3

remarks: “Recalls its support for the amended Commission proposals for the introduction of new own resources; is highly concerned by the complete lack of progress on the new own resources in the Council, in particular in view of increasing investment and unforeseen needs; considers that the introduction of new own resources, in line with the roadmap in the interinstitutional agreement of 2020, is essential to cover NGEU borrowing costs while shielding the margins and flexibility mechanisms necessary to cater for these needs;”

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
author: original text
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
remarks: “Calls on the Council to adopt new own resources as a matter of urgency in order to enable sustainable repayment of NGEU borrowing; stresses that new genuine own resources, beyond the IIA, are essential for the Union’s higher spending needs; considers that all instruments and tools should be explored in order to provide the Union with the necessary resources”
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
remarks: “and considers, in this respect, that joint borrowing presents a viable option to ensure that the Union has sufficient resources to respond to acute Union-wide crises, such as the ongoing crisis in the area of security and defence;”
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
author: MEPs
remarks:
Against new own resources
(tabled by MEPs from PfE, ECR, NI)
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
author: MEPs

Securing EU’s external border to priority in next MFF but border security should remain sovereign responsibility of national authorities
(tabled by PfE MEPs)

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN

remarks:
Key vote
Union funds to finance notably walls & physical border barriers
(tabled by PfE MEPs)

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
author: MEPs
remarks:

(tabled by PfE MEPs)
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
author: MEPs
remarks:
Against the current rule of law conditionality system and any proposals to reinforce or expand it
(tabled by PfE MEPs)
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
author: original text
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
remarks: “Considers that all instruments and tools should be explored in order to provide the Union with those resources, in line with its priorities and identified needs;”
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
remarks: “considers, in this respect, that joint borrowing through the issuance of EU bonds presents a viable option to ensure that the Union has sufficient resources to respond to acute Union-wide crises such as the ongoing crisis in the area of security and defence;”
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
author: MEPs
remarks:
No need for new own resources
(tabled by PfE MEPs)
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF BUDG 20242051INI Revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world [Muresan-Tavares]_EN
remarks:
If AM 15 is rejected = +
If AM 15 is adopted = -
(key vote)
vl_title_en: A revamped long-term budget for the Union in a changing world

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: ESN
remarks: adoption = DEVE resolution and all amendments fall
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: reform the international financial architecture to create equal power sharing and to promote equitable and inclusive development cooperation policies that support gender equality
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: general debt relief and cancellation of debt, free of economic policy conditions and accepted by all creditors as a mean to help most indebted development countries; need of domestic legislation to enforce private creditor’s participation in debt restructuring deals
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: increasing public and grants-based finance for climate mitigation and adaptation; increase grant-based finance for least developed countries and small island developing states
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: gender balance on executive boards of all international organisations; establishment of a joint committee for governance reforms in the Bretton Woods Institutions to enhance transparency and inclusivity
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: lack of transparency in the functioning of the Global Gateway (GG) in EU partner countries and absence of clear mechanisms for assessing its impact, particularly in fragile contexts; need of continuous evaluation of the GG to assess its effectiveness and strategic direction
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: MEPs
remarks: gender budgeting and improved access to affordable financing for the informal sector, dominated by micro- and small businesses, often led by women
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: blended public and private finance must be aligned with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG); need for legislation that focus on sustainable business and finance, sustainability disclosure and transparency; the set-up of a global SDG finance taxonomy
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: adoption of the UN Treaty on Business and Human Rights to regulate the activities of transnational corporations and other business enterprises and to allow victims to seek redress
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: establishment of a dedicated SDG investment facilitation mechanism to identify and develop investment-ready opportunities aligned with the SDGs in least developed countries; encouraging and incentivising SMEs by EU policies to actively contribute to sustainable development in developing countries; to prioritise allocation of grants and concessional financing based on vulnerabilities, namely in LDCs, fragile or conflict-affected countries
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: creation of a UN Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation to ensuring a fair division of taxing rights between nation states, while duly considering national tax sovereignty; tackle harmful tax practices and illicit financial flows; help developing countries to mobilise domestic resources, in particular through enhanced tax governance
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: a coordinated minimum tax on ultrahigh net worth individuals equal to 2 % of their wealth
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: concern over increasing trend of tied aid; ensure that Official Development Aid primarily benefits partner countries rather than donor economies
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
remarks: Call on the EU and the Member States to ensure that ODA includes long-term, sustainable funding for United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA), guaranteeing access to essential services for Palestinian refugees and preventing further humanitarian crises
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
remarks: long-term, sustainable funding for United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA)
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
remarks: education must remain a central pillar of EU development assistance, including continued support for UNRWA schools, which provide education to over 500 000 Palestinian children, ensuring their right to quality education despite ongoing displacement and conflict
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
remarks: UNRWA
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

file_name: VOLF DEVE 2025_2004(INI) Finance for deveopment in Seville [Charles GOERENS (Renew, LU)]_EN
author: original text
remarks: rethinking and reforming global governance of international development cooperation given the suspension of USAID and reductions in global aid by countries such as the UK, Netherlands, Belgium etc.
vl_title_en: Financing for development – ahead of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development in Seville

author: EPP
remarks: This is a political amendment reflecting tensions between the Spanish EPP and the current EIB President (former Minister in the Sanchez governments). It risks undermining the EIB’s public mandate by calling for supervisory standards suited to commercial banks. The EIB is already subject to internal controls and political oversight. Furthermore, implementing this proposal would require treaty change. Adding external supervision would add bureaucracy, reduce flexibility and delay investments. This amendment was not retained in the compromise package.

author: original text
vl_title_en: Product safety and regulatory compliance in e-commerce and non-EU imports

remarks: Calls on the Commission to revise the Consumer Protection regulation and strengthen enforcement powers against non-EU traders.
vl_title_en: Product safety and regulatory compliance in e-commerce and non-EU imports

remarks: Commission should have direct powers to investigate and sanction serious breaches of consumer law.
vl_title_en: Product safety and regulatory compliance in e-commerce and non-EU imports

author: original text
vl_title_en: Product safety and regulatory compliance in e-commerce and non-EU imports

remarks: Consumer Protection Regulation already empowers national authorities to act against non-compliant traders.
vl_title_en: Product safety and regulatory compliance in e-commerce and non-EU imports

remarks: Current limitation is that each country has to apply national penalties, making the consequences of the violations uneven.
vl_title_en: Product safety and regulatory compliance in e-commerce and non-EU imports

author: MEPs
remarks: Tabled by MEPs from PfE
vl_title_en: Product safety and regulatory compliance in e-commerce and non-EU imports

remarks: Calls on the Commission to assess the need for an EU Market Surveillance Authority.

heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0324/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks:
EU and China should use summit to ease trade tensions and jointly revive multilateralism, advocating global trade rules, guided by the principles of solidarity, cooperation, sustainability and democracy

(tabled by MEPs from Germany, Belgium, Italy)
vl_title_en: Tackling China's critical raw materials export restrictions

heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0324/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)
author: The Left
remarks:
Rejects rivalry and bloc-building, which risk empowering authoritarian and ultranationalist forces, increasing geopolitical tensions and competition for critical raw materials                                 

(tabled by MEPs from Germany, Belgium, Italy)
vl_title_en: Tackling China's critical raw materials export restrictions

heading: Joint motion for a resolution RC10-0324/2025(EPP, S&D, ECR, Renew and Greens/ EFA)

     (tabled by MEP from France)

author: The Left

author: The Left
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: PfE
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: calls for training programmes for contracting authorities to include modules on verifying compliance with occupational health and safety obligations, and on the procedures for checking employers’ mandatory training certificates, to be required of tenderers and subcontractors at the selection and contract performance stages;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement
Public procurement
Public procurement

author: MEPs
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: MEPs
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: calls for the mandatory exclusion of economic operators that have been convicted of non-compliance with rules regarding working conditions and occupational health and safety, including where the infringement is committed by a subcontractor within the execution chain, in line with the principle of proportionality;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: Considers that contracting authorities must be allowed the autonomy to exclude bids based on security risks or out of respect for fundamental human rights and international law;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: Stresses that SMEs’ efforts to explore other Member States’ markets should be supported; calls for the sharing of best practice across the EU and the simplification of cross-border procurement procedures;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: calls on the Member States to encourage business participation in cross-border public procurement by refraining from using language criteria to decline bids in tender procedures;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
remarks: Calls on the Commission, the Member States and contracting authorities to make full use of the available tools such as the EU’s trade defence toolbox, to prevent unfair competition from non-EU countries that discriminate against EU countries’ participation in their public procurement processes...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
remarks: Recalls that the conditions set out in ILO Convention No 94 on Labour Clauses should be respected, and considers that countries that do not comply with them should not be able to access EU public procurement processes;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: MEPs
remarks: Calls on the Commission to set out clearly that bidders from non-EU countries are not eligible to participate in public procurement procedures conducted within the EU if their country of origin does not give, on the basis of a plurilateral or bilateral agreement on public procurement signed with the EU, reciprocal market access for EU bidders;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: Text as a whole excluding the words “including environmental and climate-related considerations”
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: the words “including environmental and climate-related considerations”
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: Text as a whole excluding the words “and climate-related criteria”
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: the words “and climate-related criteria”
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: PfE
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
remarks: Stresses that the development and use of trustworthy, high-quality and transparent sustainability labels and certifications help contracting authorities operationalise sustainability objectives, thus reducing the administrative burden and the need for in-depth technical assessments; calls on the Commission to promote and further develop such labels at EU level, ensuring their credibility and usability across sectors;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: Underlines, in the light of CJEU case-law (including Case C-395/18), that contracting authorities are entitled to include requirements based on national labour law in procurement documentation
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: such as binding collective agreements, minimum employment standards, equal pay provisions, and other relevant social criteria; welcomes the clarification by the CJEU that the social and environmental obligations in the Horizontal Social Clause are ‘a cardinal value with which the Member States must ensure compliance’;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: calls on the Commission to develop guidance and a legal framework, including clarification of the subject matter and its practical application, that ensures legal certainty and empowers contracting authorities – within their own discretion – to apply such criteria without facing disproportionate legal risks;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: ... calls on the Commission to ensure that the horizontal social clause is applied across articles in the revision of the public procurement directives...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: Stresses that current public procurement rules and the lack of strong and effective social conditions have created a downward pressure on labour costs and collective bargaining, and subsequently on working conditions and workers’ wages under public contracts;...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: ... ; considers that significant mandatory award criteria connected to collective bargaining, including the provision of an advantage to tenderers whose workers, and whose subcontractors’ workers, are covered by collective agreements,...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: ... Regrets that the strong requirement for a ‘link to the subject matter’ and the ban on references to ‘general corporate policies’ in procurement criteria has led to widespread legal uncertainty for, and litigation against, public authorities wishing to include strong social criteria, such as collective bargaining clauses, in tenders;...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: Calls on the Commission to clarify the notion of the ‘link to the subject matter’ with regard to the use of sustainability and social criteria, and to establish a maximum weighting for considerations that contracting authorities are allowed to introduce that are not linked to the subject matter, such as activities that support social objectives, or corporate social responsibility policies;...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: EMPL
remarks: Welcomes...the use of social conditionalities in public funding ensures that workers benefit from the support provided to industry, including to promote collective bargaining...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: calls on the Commission to introduce social conditionality requiring tenderers to submit, at the selection stage, a certificate confirming that employers have completed mandatory training in occupational health and safety, and to carry out periodic checks during the execution stage, with failure to comply with these obligations constituting grounds for exclusion, termination and/or effective contractual penalties;...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: PfE
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: EMPL
remarks: Calls on the Commission...to introduce award criteria...including giving adequate weighting to companies whose workers and whose subcontractors’ workers are covered by collective agreements...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: EMPL
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: Greens/ EFA
remarks:
adoption 34 = 36 falls
requests that the Commission address, as part of the upcoming revision of EU public procurement rules, how sustainability-related aspects can be systematically integrated when applying the principle of the most economically advantageous tender, in order to place value on high-quality products and services and foster innovation and efficient resource use;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: S&D
remarks: calls on the Commission in the context of the forthcoming fitness check on EU public procurement legislation to establish sector-specific sustainability criteria comprising model award and technical criteria, verification methodologies and contractual provisions, with a view to facilitating the progressive adoption and, ultimately, the systematic use of sustainable public procurement, offering clarity for contracting authorities...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: Text as a whole excluding the words ‘highlights....EU legislation’
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: The words ‘highlights the importance of introducing and implementing sustainability criteria across Member States in a way that reflects current EU legislation’
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: Greens/ EFA
remarks: calls on the Commission to establish a Buy European and Sustainable Act to support EU strategic autonomy and resilience by introducing European preference and sustainability criteria for goods and services in strategic sectors, such as medicines, pharmaceuticals, clean technologies, and cloud and digital infrastructures;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: ESN
remarks: Considers that contracting authorities in the EU should be able to apply regional and/or national preference criteria when awarding their public contracts;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks:
adoption 18 = 37 falls
possible ways of prioritising the ‘European preference’ principle, for instance by allowing contracting authorities to give preference to bids including at least 65 % of added value generated within the territory of the EU, in procurement related to strategic sectors and key technologies for the future, such as steel, the automotive industry, the transport industry, healthcare and pharmaceuticals, energy, artificial intelligence, quantum technologies, semiconductors, 5G and 6G, biotechnologies, net zero technologies, mobility, chemicals and advanced materials
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: S&D
remarks: Requests that the Commission conduct an in-depth impact assessment, in the context of the upcoming review of the public procurement framework, in order to propose criteria to prioritise European goods and services for strategic sectors, such as heavy industry, medicines, pharmaceuticals, 5G/6G, net zero technologies, cloud infrastructure, AI, food, energy and chemicals,...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: MEPs
remarks: invites the Commission, furthermore, to examine opportunities to boost the participation of EU-based companies in procurement processes launched for projects financed by EU institutions or by extension of the preference system set out in Article 85 of Directive 2014/25/EU to contracts awarded by contracting authorities and in Article 15 of Directive 2014/24/EU for targeted strategic sectors;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: Requests that the Commission conduct an in-depth impact assessment, in the context of the upcoming review of the public procurement framework, on possible ways and implications of prioritising the ‘European preference’ principle in procurement related to strategic industries so as to ensure the continuity of critical capabilities in Member States and bolster resilience, security, competitiveness and strategic autonomy;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: The words ‘emphasises that the Commission should carefully evaluate the potential cost implications, the risks of limiting access to cutting-edge technologies, and the effects on the quality of services and products, while maintaining consistency with the EU’s international legal commitments and not excluding like-minded partners; underlines that any measures to promote the participation of European companies should not amount to protectionism or distort competition;’
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: Calls for the inclusion, in public procurement procedures concerning projects of strategic interest for the EU – particularly in the fields of critical infrastructure, advanced technologies and critical raw materials – of provisions allowing contracting authorities to require economic operators to establish industrial partnerships with legal entities based in the EU; is of the view that such partnerships should include clauses ensuring the transfer of technologies, know-how or key technical skills to EU-based partners, in full compliance with Union law and international commitments
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: original text
vl_title_en: Public procurement

remarks: the words “and environmental”

remarks: ... notes the potential for accreditation systems to be used to determine companies’ technical and financial capacity and verify their professional integrity prior to the tender process and that professional integrity criteria should encompass their track record of compliance with applicable labour, human rights and international law, as well as environmental laws;...

remarks: Stresses that the gender perspective of public procurement needs to be strengthened to foster gender equality; calls on the Commission to use the upcoming revision to expand Annex X in order to ensure that ILO Conventions No 100 and No 111 are included therein, along with the Pay Transparency Directive, the Work Life Balance Directive and the Women on Boards Directive;

author: original text
remarks: whereas the European Labour Authority (ELA) found that ‘when the lowest price is used as the only selection criteria, the risk of undeclared work increases due to the pressure on labour costs’; whereas the ELA also noted that ‘It is widely acknowledged that prioritising the lowest price criterion in public procurement may create an environment where labour law violations are more likely to occur due to cost-cutting pressures and inadequate oversight; ...
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: ESN
remarks: whereas to support European businesses, it is more effective and more economical to reserve a share of public procurement for European companies, rather than provide them with aid and subsidies;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: PfE
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: whereas considering the challenges related to European industrial sovereignty and the need to preserve and strengthen European jobs and know-how, public procurement should be used as a major strategic lever to promote the creation of added value within the EU, thereby enhancing industrial resilience and the sustainability of European supply chains;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: The Left
remarks: whereas contracting authorities in the EU should be allowed to give preference to bids that include a significant proportion of added value produced within the EU;
vl_title_en: Public procurement

author: PfE
remarks: whereas non-EU countries that are not part of the WTO Agreement on Government Procurement (GPA) or that have not concluded international agreements with the EU guaranteeing equal and reciprocal access to public procurement cannot participate in EU public procurement processes; whereas in certain sectors, access to European public procurement should be made conditional on the manufacturing of goods within the EU and/or the transfer of non-European technologies, for instance through the establishment of joint ventures;

subject_of_the_amendment: Amendments by the committee responsible -block vote
author: committee
vl_title_en: Package travel and linked travel arrangements: make the protection of travellers more effective and simplify and clarify certain aspects

subject_of_the_amendment: Amendments by the committee responsible -separate vote(s)
author: committee
remarks: if, before the traveller agrees to pay for a first travel service, the trader actively invites the traveller to book one or more additional types of travel services at the same point of sale within 24 hours of agreeing to pay for the first service, or
vl_title_en: Package travel and linked travel arrangements: make the protection of travellers more effective and simplify and clarify certain aspects

subject_of_the_amendment: Amendments by the committee responsible -separate vote(s)
author: committee
remarks: When a traveller submits a complaint using the mechanism referred to in paragraph 1a, the organiser or retailer shall confirm the receipt with a copy of the exchanges, within seven working days of submission of the complaint. The organiser or the retailer shall give a reasoned reply to the traveller within 30 working days. Organisers and retailers shall keep the data necessary to assess the complaint for the duration of the entire complaint-handling procedure and shall make that data available to national enforcement bodies upon request.
vl_title_en: Package travel and linked travel arrangements: make the protection of travellers more effective and simplify and clarify certain aspects

subject_of_the_amendment: Amendments by the committee responsible -separate vote(s)
author: committee
remarks: Details of the complaint-handling procedure shall be made available on the website of the organisers and retailers offering services covered by this Directive
vl_title_en: Package travel and linked travel arrangements: make the protection of travellers more effective and simplify and clarify certain aspects

subject_of_the_amendment: Amendments by the committee responsible -separate vote(s)
author: committee
remarks: The submission of complaints by travellers using the mechanism referred to in paragraph 1a shall be without prejudice to their rights to submit disputes for out-of-court resolution in accordance with Article 26a, or to seek redress through court proceedings, subject to periods of limitation in accordance with national law.
vl_title_en: Package travel and linked travel arrangements: make the protection of travellers more effective and simplify and clarify certain aspects

subject_of_the_amendment: Amendments by the committee responsible -separate vote(s)
author: committee
remarks: The maximum amount of the fines shall be at least 4% of the trader’s annual turnover in the Member State or Member States concerned. Member States shall notify the Commission of those rules and measures and shall notify it without delay of any subsequent amendment affecting them.’
vl_title_en: Package travel and linked travel arrangements: make the protection of travellers more effective and simplify and clarify certain aspects

remarks: purchased from separate traders through linked online booking processes where the traveller's personal data through which the traveller can be identified as a contracting party, are transmitted from the trader with whom the first contract is concluded to another trader or traders and a contract or contracts is or are concluded at the latest 24 hours after the confirmation of the booking of the first travel service with the latter trader or traders,

author: PfE
remarks: adoption 87 = 36 falls

author: committee
remarks: ‘unavoidable and extraordinary circumstances’ means a situation beyond the control of the party ..., including inter alia war or conflict, other serious security problems such as terrorism, significant risks to human health such as the outbreak of a serious disease at the travel destination, or natural disasters such as floods, earthquakes or weather conditions which make it impossible to travel safely to the destination as agreed in the package travel contract;

author: MEPs

vl_title_en: Strengthening of the position of farmers in the food supply chain

subject_of_the_amendment: Article 1, § 1, point 2Regulation (EU) No 1308/2013Article 148, § 4, point c), point i, second indent
author: MEPs
remarks:
adoption 133 = 48 falls
On initiative of Norbert Lins (EPP, DE)
Amendment deletes provision requiring milk prices in contracts to be calculated using certain indicators
–be calculated by combining various factors set out in the contract, which shall include objective indicators, indices or methods of calculation of the final price, that are easily accessible and comprehensible and that reflect changes in market conditions and production costs, the quantities delivered and the quality or composition of the milk and milk products delivered. To that effect, Member States may determine indicators, in accordance with objective criteria based on studies carried out on production and the food supply chain. The parties to the contracts shall be free to refer to these indicators or any other indicators;

Every delivery in the Union of agricultural products from a sector listed in Article 1(2), other than milk and milk products and sugar, by a farmer, a producer organisation or an association of producer organisations to a processor, distributor or retailer, shall be covered by a written contract between the parties.
vl_title_en: Strengthening of the position of farmers in the food supply chain

vl_title_en: Strengthening of the position of farmers in the food supply chain

subject_of_the_amendment: Article 1, § 1, point 6Regulation (EU) No 1308/2013Article 168, § 4, point c), point i, second indent
author: MEPs
remarks:
adoption 139 = 77 falls
On initiative of Norbert Lins (EPP, DE)
Amendment deletes provision requiring agricultural product prices in contracts to be calculated using certain indicators
–be calculated by combining various factors set out in the contract, which shall include objective indicators, indices or methods of calculation of the final price, that are easily accessible and comprehensible and that reflect changes in market conditions and production costs, the quantities delivered and the quality or composition of the agricultural products delivered; to that effect, Member States may determine indicators, in accordance with objective criteria based on studies carried out on production and the food supply chain. The parties to the contracts shall be free to refer to these indicators or any other indicators which they deem relevant.
vl_title_en: Strengthening of the position of farmers in the food supply chain

remarks:
adoption 126 = 113 falls
Renew Veggie-Burger amendment
Renew withdrew the RCV
Only the use of terms that are explicitly tied to animal terms should be prohibited, rather than format-based terms such as “burger” and “steak”. It broadens the scope to also include insect-derived products and underlines the need to ensure clarity and protection of consumers.

author: committee
remarks: AGRI committee AM better than Commission proposal
vl_title_en: Strengthening of the position of farmers in the food supply chain

author: Greens/ EFA
remarks:
Amendment imposes rigid requirements by prescribing detailed content of the contract
(15)Certain Member States have decided that all deliveries of agricultural products in their territory are to be covered by written contracts between the parties. Where the Member States do not make use of this possibility, farmers, producer organisations or associations of producer organisations can request the use of written contracts. However, due to the weaker bargaining position of farmers and the fear of commercial retaliation by purchasers, it can be difficult for farmers and their associations to make such a request. To increase trust, transparency, and efficiency within the supply chain and to enable all farmers, producer organisations and associations of producer organisations to benefit from the use of written contracts, deliveries of agricultural products in the Union by a farmer, a producer organisation or an association of producer organisations to a processor, distributor or retailer should be covered by a written contract. […]The content of those written contracts should also be improved, to integrate relevant factors including production cost and market conditions, in order that farmers consistently receive a price covering their production costs.
vl_title_en: Strengthening of the position of farmers in the food supply chain

author: MEPs
remarks:
